page.title: 12Eyebrook Landscape
page.content: The landscape of this area is mainly water,the reservoir covering 164.5 ha of ground. There is a plantation of coniferous woodland,mainly spruce trees on the south and eastern flanks. These trees provide dunnage for the Corby Tubeworks. The dam wall is grassed and a drystone wall of York- shire stone can be found to the south of the dam.Apart from one adjoining field which is grass where clay quarrying took place to construct the dam,the surrounding land is given over to mixed farming.There are fields of cereals and pasture,mostly bounded by hawthorn hedges.Around the perimeter is a road,closed to the general public on the east,being owned by the water company.There is a wooden clubhouse for those coming to fish,and a fish farm,for restocking the reservoir situated in the Southeastern corner.
